regular.translation[0].definitions[0].de: happening every hour, every week, every month etc, usually with the same amount of time in between
regular.translation[0].definitions[0].ex: The company holds regular meetings with employees.
His breathing was slow and regular.
Trains will run at regular intervals from 11am to 4pm.
We hear from him on a regular basis.
He phones us every Sunday at six, regular as clockwork (=always at the same time).
a regular job (=a job that you do during normal working hours)
regular.translation[0].definitions[1].de: happening or doing something very often
regular.translation[0].definitions[1].ex: Regular exercise helps keep your weight down.
Penn Station was in regular use (=people used it often) until the 1960s.
He’s one of the bar’s regular customers.
regular.translation[0].definitions[2].ex: He has returned to his regular duties.
Our regular opening hours are 10am to 7pm.
regular.translation[0].definitions[3].de: with the same amount of space between each thing and the next
regular.translation[0].definitions[3].ex: The pipes were placed at regular intervals.
a carpet with a regular pattern of flowers
regular.translation[0].definitions[4].de: ordinary, without any special feature or qualities
regular.translation[0].definitions[5].de: of a normal or standard size
regular.translation[0].definitions[6].de: evenly shaped with parts or sides of equal size
regular.translation[0].definitions[6].ex: He’s very handsome, with strong regular features (=an evenly shaped face).
regular.translation[0].definitions[7].de: a regular verb changes its forms in the same way as most verbs, for example its past tense and past participle end in ‘ed’. The verb ‘dance’ is regular, but the verb ‘be’ is not.
regular.translation[0].definitions[8].de: used to emphasize what you think someone is like
regular.translation[1].definitions[0].de: someone who often goes to the same bar, restaurant etc or who takes part in an activity very often
regular.translation[1].definitions[0].ex: The barman knows all the regulars by name.
regular.translation[1].definitions[1].de: a soldier whose permanent job is in the army
regular.translation[2].definitions[0].de: happening at the same time each day, month, year etc, usually quite often
regular.translation[2].definitions[0].ex: At least the job guarantees you a regular income.
Payments should be madeat regular intervals, preferably weekly.
Make sure you back up the data on a regular basis.
regular.translation[2].definitions[1].de: of a normal or standard size or amount
regular.translation[2].definitions[1].ex: We offer three sizes: small, regular and large.
regular.translation[2].definitions[2].de: a customer who always goes to the same shop or uses the same service
regular.translation[2].definitions[2].ex: A discount is available to our regular customers.
regular.translation[2].definitions[3].de: people who work for a company for the whole of the working day or week, not for just some of the time
regular.translation[2].definitions[3].ex: union fears that casual workers were replacing regular staff
regular.translation[3].definitions[0].de: a customer who goes to the same shop etc very often
